str2: So that, therefore, so then, so as to. From hos and te; so too, i.e. Thus therefore.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To boast; I glory (exult) proudly. From some base akin to that of aucheo and euchomai; to vaunt.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
